body:
While following the 'Using Helm' documentation, I ran into an issue with creating a release for the stable/mariadb pod based on the example in the documentation. 

I created the release using these commands as per the doc:
```
$ echo 'mariadbUser: user0' > config.yaml
$ helm install -f config.yaml stable/mariadb
```

However, this resulted in the release not coming up correctly. Digging some more, I found the mariadb pod in CrashLoopBackOff:

```
sleap:~ # kubectl get pods
NAME                                       READY     STATUS             RESTARTS   AGE
fancy-angelfish-mariadb-4185935934-tz6hs   0/1       CrashLoopBackOff   4          3m
```

And finally looking at the logs:
```
sleap:~ # kubectl logs fancy-angelfish-mariadb-4185935934-tz6hs

Welcome to the Bitnami mariadb container
Subscribe to project updates by watching https://github.com/bitnami/bitnami-docker-mariadb
Submit issues and feature requests at https://github.com/bitnami/bitnami-docker-mariadb/issues
Send us your feedback at containers@bitnami.com

WARN  ==> You set the environment variable ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD=yes. For safety reasons, do not use this flag in a production environment.
nami    INFO  Initializing mariadb
mariadb INFO  ==> Configuring permissions...
mariadb INFO  ==> Validating inputs...
mariadb WARN  Allowing the "rootPassword" input to be empty
mariadb WARN  Allowing the "password" input to be empty
Error executing 'postInstallation': In order to use a custom username you need to create first a database owned by that user.Please provide the --database property as well
```

So it looks like the new stable/mariadb chart requires you to provide a database property as well.
Without this, the example in the documentation is broken and doesn't work as expected.
title: Incorrect example in the "using helm" documentation
